alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 8:12PM EDT until July 16 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR BRISTOL AND PLYMOUTH COUNTIES... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms continuing to produce heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Massachusetts Department of Transportation reports the northbound side of Route 138 in Somerset was closed from flooding. In addition, a number of smaller creeks and rivers in the warned area have experienced sharp rises, including but not limited to the Segregansett River in Dighton, Indian Head River in Hanover and the Wading River in Norton. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. The northbound side of route 138 in Somerset is closed due to flooding. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Sharp rises on streams and creeks to near or over bankfull can be expected. Urban flash flooding is possible in larger cities in the warned area, including but not limited to New Bedford, Fall River and Taunton. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Bedford, Brockton, Fall River, Plymouth, Taunton, Dartmouth, North Attleborough, Bridgewater, Marshfield, Marion, Attleboro, Mansfield, Middleborough, Easton, Wareham, Bourne, Norton, Somerset, Scituate and Pembroke. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
